org.rack4java
Interface Rack

All Known Implementing Classes:
Echo, FileServer, HelloWorld
public interface Rack

The interface implemented by all Rack applications

This interface is deliberately minimal so that it is very simple to implement.

An example of a "Hello World" Rack application might be: 

  public class HelloWorld implements Rack {
  public RackResponse call(Map input) {
      return new RackResponse(200, 
              "Hello World", 
              "Content-Type", "text/plain");
      }
  }

Author:
Frank Carver
See Also:
RackResponse

Method Detail

call

RackResponse call(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> environment)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
The single method implemented by all Rack applications

Parameters:
environment - a map of named values combining both the server environment and the HTTP request
Returns:
a RackResponse object with status code, headers and either a String, byte[] or File payload
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
